line_1: Tho' at Sash-Window, on the Stairs,
line_2: At Court, nay (Authors say) at Pray'rs. —

line_1: Then whilst I softly scal'd the Stairs,
line_2: And the old Aunt lock'd up at Prayers

line_1: Then whilst I softly scal'd the Stairs,
line_2: For blessings on her House Affairs.

line_1: To call her softly crept up Stairs;
line_2: And fearing she should wake my Dears

line_1: To be the Table Talk of clubs up stairs,
line_2: To which th' unwash'd artificer repairs,
That morn she miss'd her pray'rs;

line_1: It tumbled down a thousand pair of stairs,
line_2: First most devoutly having said its prayers,

line_1: To mount her fifty Flights of ample Stairs.
line_2: With better Strength, on Visit-days she bears

line_1: In comes another Set, and kicketh them down Stairs.
In comes another Set, and kicketh them down Stairs.
line_2: When lo! push'd up to Power, and crown'd their Cares,

line_1: Thrice has she tumbled up the stairs,
line_2: And that's good luck the maid avers.

line_1: But there Belinda meets you on the stairs,
line_2: Easy her shape, attracting all her airs;

line_1: And singing of spiritual Hymns on the Stairs.
line_2: For ROGER is constantly saying his Pray'rs,

line_1: He roar'd to his Frenchman to kick them down Stairs.
line_2: So while they were playing their musical Airs,

line_1: He roar'd to his Frenchman to kick them down Stairs.
line_2: And I was just dancing the Hay round the Chairs,

line_1: With the Fiddles I heard in the Room above Stairs,
line_2: Ods Bobs! how delighted I was unawares

line_1: Prepar'd to Scrub the Entry and the Stairs.
